data.title: 5 Amazing Things to Do at Universal Studios Hollywood
data.meta_description: Soak up the movie magic at Universal Studios Hollywood, the working film and television studio combined with a theme park.
data.text:
Covering more than 400 acres in the middle of Los Angeles, Universal Studios Hollywood gives you a behind-the-scenes peek into Hollywoodâs inner workings. Youâll learn what makes the movies so thrillingâand so enchantingâas you immerse yourself in real-life and virtual film sets and take a seat for world-class action rides amped up with dizzying special effects.

Ride the Studio Tour

Start by taking the one-hour World-Famous Studio Tour, constructed with creative advice from Stephen Spielberg. For the experience, youâll board a tram carâsome of which have been converted to be all-electric vehiclesâto be treated to a peek at 13 blocks of back-lot movie and television show sets, plus some simulated thrills. All the while, your tour is video-hosted by comedian Jimmy Fallon. Cinema buffs will love seeing actual props and film characters like King Kong, Jaws, and dozens of dinosaurs. Youâll cruise by the Bates Motel from the film Psycho and the set from the TV series Desperate Housewives (remember Wisteria Lane?). Youâll experience movie-making virtual reality as you âsurviveâ an earthquake, flash flood, and avalanche.

Explore the Wizarding World of Harry Potter

Next, step into The Wizarding World of Harry Potter, with a towering Hogwarts castle and all the classrooms, corridors, and passageways you know from the films. Watch a wand choose its owner at Ollivanders, and sample food fit for wizards in Hogsmeade Village. Buy chocolate frogs and peppermint toads at Honeydukes, or sip a mug of butterbeer or pumpkin juice at Three Broomsticks, a fairy-tale tavern serving traditional British fare (bangers and mash and shepherdâs pie). You might need a reality check after âflyingâ over Hogwarts on the Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey ride. (Ask your companions: âDid that just happen?â). Young kids will enjoy the not-too-scary Flight of the Hippogriff rollercoaster, which zooms around Hagridâs pumpkin patch.

Enjoy Jurassic WorldâThe Ride

Watch a showdown between dinosaurs at Jurassic WorldâThe Ride. This âsequelâ to the parkâs Jurassic Park ride was created by some of the same folks behind the blockbuster movie series, including Steven Spielberg and Jurassic World director Colin Trevorrow. Board a 25-person boat and glide through various lands of dinosaurs, check out the video âwarningsâ from Jurassic World stars Chris Pratt and BD Wong, then watch an Indominus rex and T. rex battle it outâall before your raft takes an 84-foot water plunge. On your way out, let the kids dig for fossils in the play area or relax with some refreshments at the areaâs Isla Nu-Bar and Jurassic CafÃ©.

Discover The Secret Life of Pets: Off the Leash

Get ready to meet a few new notable movie âcrittersâ in The Secret Life of Pets: Off the Leash attraction, which features a hyper-realistic encounter with 64 animated figures from the Secret Life of Pets movies, including Max, Snowball, Gidget, and Duke. Youâll take on the role of a stray puppy in search of a forever home as youâre whisked around New York City in this gentle two-seater experience, meeting new four-legged friends along the way.

Watch the WaterWorld Live Show

The 1995 Kevin Costner film WaterWorld may not have been a big box-office hit, but it makes a thrilling live outdoor show. Youâll cheer on steampunk-garbed stuntmen and stuntwomen as they perform daredevil featsâdiving into the water from impossibly high towers and racing around on jet skis. The stunning pyrotechnic effects in WaterWorld will blow your mind. Even though anything is possible in Hollywood, itâs still hard to believe your eyes when a flaming seaplane flies over the set and crashes with a big splash.
